item.title: Introduction to Cookie
item.description: What is a HTTP Cookie? Cookies are small files that is sent from a website(server) and stored on users’s computer by a browser. It is also called web cookie, Internet cookie, browser cookie or simply cookie. Usage Cookies are mainly used for these purposes Session management (user logins, shopping carts) Personalization (user preferences) Tracking (analyzing user behavior) source : MDN How server/client sends cookie? Server to Browser The server tells the client (Browser) to store a cookie using the Set-Cookie HTTP header.
